_header: Lordings if it be your will / And ye will hear and hold you still
_description: ‘Vita Sancti Cristoferi’ — in couplets with a 5-line monorhyming introduction

Lincoln91.First Lines:
Lordynges if it be ȝowre willAnd ȝe will here & holde
                    ȝow still…
Lincoln91.Last Lines:
…Thaire are samene inheuens blysseGod bryng vs thedir when his
                    will es Amen
Lincoln91.Attributed Title:
Vita Sancti Christofori [ ]e bygynnes þe lyffe of &
                        of Story of [ ]aynte Christofre to þe heryng or þe [
                    ]yng of þe whilke storye langes [ ]te mede & it be donne with deuocioun
                    (f. 122v); Explicit vita sancti christofori (f.
                        129vb)
Lincoln91.Facsimiles:
Brewer,  Derek Stanley,  and  A. E. B. Owen.  
             “Introduction.” 
             The Thornton Manuscript (Lincoln Cathedral MS. 91).
         London: Scolar Press, 1975.
Lincoln91.Editions:
Horstmann,  Carl. 
             Altenglische Legenden: Neue Folge.
         Heilbronn: Henninger, 1881: 454-66.
